title: Error when trying to Get Messages - Error with account ...com.au (POP3)
content:
Hi,

I've been trying to get to the bottom of an error message that keeps coming up on my client's computer. They first noticed the error (ss) about a couple of weeks ago and anything from then won't download (incoming), but I believe they are able to send emails. I can see that the messages are 'waiting' on the server at least and they can temporarily use Webmail.

I looked through the forums and any other info I could find and have checked or tried the following:

  • If their Antivirus or Firewall are blocking access
  • There is enough space on their system
  • File permissions for the 'Thunderbird' folder
  • Access details
  • Downgrading to an earlier version of Thunderbird

Unfortunately the error is still coming up each time they try to get their messages.

They have been using Thunderbird for almost a year now with one minor issue in that time. And I'm a bit puzzled as to what to try next. Has something similar happened to anyone else? Any suggestions for what I can do or check next?

The email account is through their domain and hosting and they are using Windows 8 and Thunderbird version 102.15.1 (from version 115.18.0 - 32-bit).

Thanks
creator: metalphoenix

title: Import from Outlook is freeze crashing
content:
Hi, I'm trying to import all my emails from Outlook 2019 (5GB) on Windows 10 in KVM , TB 137.0.1 During the import process starts to hang / freeze after having imported about 1.4GB. When I check the task manager for activity, there is non. I.e. CPU activity is very low (where it should be about 80 - 100%) and no disk activiy is going on for about 30 min. I close Thunderbird, but I can't reopen TB. It says it's already open. So I kill the tb process. Then I re-open TB and it has about 1.4GB of e-mail imported. crash reports bp-2189a8c5-f639-4dd2-abfb-257f10250408 bp-34687354-02bc-4ebe-90fc-855d20250408

Is there something that can be done to fix the issue?

Thanks & Regards, Hermann

title: "Use paragraph format instead of body text" setting won't stick
content:
Hello. I want to remain in body text - that is, with no double spacing of paragraphs - when I compose e-mails. I have done a good bit of searching and the answer I keep finding is "Uncheck the 'Use paragraph format instead of body text' box in Composition on the Options tab." The problem is that every time I close and re-open Thunderbird, the option has been automatically re-checked. This happens even if I uncheck the box, close the program, and then immediately re-open it without having written an e-mail or done anything else. So this has nothing to do with importing formatting by responding to an existing e-mail. I found the corresponding setting in the Config Editor and set it to False, but the same thing happens: It defaults back to True as soon as I re-open Thunderbird. Is there something I can do to keep that "Use paragraph formatting" option turned off?

I am using Thunderbird version 68.12.1, 64 bit.

Thanks in advance for any help.
creator: shardstrat

title: Re-install failing
content:
Following a serious problem unconnected with Thunderbird (which I have been using successfully for a number of years), I recovered Windows 10 and have struggled to reinstall all non-Windows apps (including Firefox, my web browser, also for more years than I can count). Only Thunderbird is resisting re-installation. Fortunately Webmail is working so we aren't quite cut off, but I'd like Thunderbird back. The installation process tells me it's installed, but when I try it I get the message: 'Thunderbird failed to find the settings for your email account'.

So: what can I do? How can Webmail be happily working with, presumably, those same settings? I called Plusnet who were helpfull as ever but they couldn't do anything.

Incidentally, Thunderbird and all its files disappeared during the recovery process - if that helps. I am in the habit of copying the Profiles to a memory stick every month and have the most recent, about a month old.

Email: john@wilson48.plus.com

title: How can I configure compact? ver. 102.15.1
content:
The support article at https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/compacting-folders#w_how-can-i-configure-compact gives the answer to this question as ≡ > Preferences (formerly Options) > Network & Disk Space > Disk Space . 

  However, in ver. 102.15.1, I cannot find Preferences or Options anywhere.. Where do I go?   I want to configure compact because, ever since I said to compact automatically some months ago, the compact process causes (1) all emails in the current folder to disappear for some seconds and (2) cancels the conversation thread mode and I have to remember to un-cancel it.   If I can work out how to configure compact, I'll probably go back to doing it manually (at times that suit me) to avoid these 2 problems.

title: Thunderbird opens but account is gone
content:
This happened after a Win10 update and caused a PC to auto reboot overnight. User came in and tried to start Thunderbird and there was nothing there. Here is a screenshot of what it looks like when Thunderbird opens:

https://i.imgur.com/CX9QOma.png

What's weird is, if you go to the address book tab, the email addys are there and if you search for a contact or a keyword in the search bar, it shows the messages. But there's no accounts showing at all. I did some search on Google and I haven't found anything that helps so far. The closest I came to what I was hoping was going to be a solutions was this:

https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1402124

But it doesn't appear that the JS file is corrupt because there are none of the 2 other JS files mentioned in that solution that shows the pref.js file to be corrupted. But if I open that JS file, I get this error:

https://i.imgur.com/JAv908Y.png

So I'm not sure if it's corrupted or not? I'm at a loss as to what to try next. I've tried re-importing that profile and I get an error when I try that, so I'm not really sure what direction to go next. Any help would be greatly appreciated.

This is the most current version of Thunderbird (128.9.1esr)
creator: thelancinator96

title: Emails going into a black hole
content:
I posted a similar question earlier, and although I never got any useful advice, the problem of random emails disappearing from my PC seems to have resolved itself after a week or so. However the problem has now turned up again, but this time on my husband's PC (both PCs are running Windows 10 and latest version of Thunderbird). None of the three accounts on his PC is receiving emails, although Thunderbird correctly enters the number of 'unread' emails and updates it when more arrive. The emails do arrive on my own PC and on my Apple devices (all of these also receive email for all three Thunderbird accounts), but they do not arrive on his desktop PC: the only way he can read his email at present is for me to forward it from the inbox on one of my devices to his Gmail account. If I do this, Tbird seems to recognize that the email has been opened and read, and on his PC the number of unread messages is updated (it might be worth noting that the number appears in grey, not blue as usual). He is able to send new emails from Tbird, although of course he is unable to reply to the messages that are not displayed there. It is particularly annoying because most of the missing mail is either business related or updates on medical appointments, etc.

I really cannot understand this problem, and am probably not explaining it very well. Thunderbird on his PC seems to recognize that new emails are coming in to all three accounts, because the number of unread messages updates, but the messages themselves are not being displayed (I've looked for them in junk, deleted, etc., but no luck). There are no filters set up to redirect things (except a few to send scams to junk). And all the emails are coming in fine to all three accounts on my PC, as well as my Apple devices & our server's webmail function.

If anyone can help, we would be very grateful. We are long-time Thunderbird users, and would hate to have to give it up and learn something new. Many thanks.
creator: Janet1593
